general.label: General Settings
general.comment: In this tab you will be able to configure general settings such as: Responsive Layout, Right to Left Layout, Fluid Width Layout, Box/Wide Layout, Full Slideshow, Header Style, Currency Style, Language Style, Sticky Menu, Sticky Top Cart, Sticky Top Search, Animate Effects...

disable_responsive.label: Responsive Layout
disable_responsive.comment: Responsive Layout: detect the visitor's screen size and orientation and change the layout accordingly. Your websites work well and look great no matter what device you're being viewed on. Small + Medium + Large screen. One site for every screen!

right_to_left.label: Right to Left Layout
right_to_left.comment: Right to Left Layout: most of the user interface will appear mirrored automatically for you. The text direction changes to right-to-left with the exception of phone numbers and country codes which are always left-to-right. Click on this image to preview.

fluid_layout.label: Fluid Width Layout
fluid_layout.comment: Fluid layout: allows the layout of page elements to grow or shrink to pre-determined maximum or minimum widths, therefore accommodating a width range in which the browser can adapt the layout. Click on this image to preview.

box_wide.label: Box/Wide Layout
box_wide.comment: Box/Wide Layout: You can use this theme in wide or boxed layout variants. Wide layout is perfect for you, if you like airy websites, with no visible borders or page edges. Boxed layout comes with different ready-to-use background patterns & images, or you can define any color you would like to use by simply picking it with colorpicker. This theme comes with a lot of pre-defined patterns to choose from. Click on these images to preview.

wideslide_full.label: Full Slideshow
wideslide_full.comment: Full Slideshow: This is a supersized slideshow that automatically expands to fill up the container it's in to let you display a slideshow that either covers a certain section inside the page. Click on this image to preview.

header_mobile.label: Show mobile header on PC
header_mobile.comment: Header Mobile on PC: Allow to display mobile header when you resize your site into mobile width on PC. Used for test display mobile, you should disable it when public your site

sticky_cart.label: Sticky Top Cart On Scroll
sticky_cart.comment: Sticky Top Cart: gives your shopping cart users an easy sliding cart, which sticks to the position on page if web pages scrolls down too down, so cart users get better user experience to your site.

sticky_search.label: Sticky Top Search On Scroll
sticky_search.comment: Sticky Top Search: Using this sticky seach you can choose to display the same, or a different header when the user scrolls, to helps users to search easily

disable_default_nav.label: Default Navigation
disable_default_nav.comment: If using EM MegaMenuPro, default catalog navigation should be disabled. If EM MageMenuPro isn't install, default catalog navigation is always enable

freezed_top_menu.label: Sticky Menu On Scroll
freezed_top_menu.comment: Sticky Menu is basically a website menu that is locked into place so that it does not disappear when the user scrolls down the page; in other words, it is accessible from anywhere on the website without having to scroll.

Note: Less Css File must always be first.
E.g.: custom1.less
E.g.: custom2.css

custom_css.label: Your Custom CSS
custom_css.comment:
If you have coding knowledge and want to customize your site beyond the styling options in the default theme settings, you can add custom CSS code to here.
If you do decide to apply custom CSS to your site, it should be used sparingly. Customer Care doesn't offer assistance or troubleshooting for CSS modifications. We also can't provide you with code or support for any third-party code modification.
Here are a few popular and credible websites we like to recommend for CSS tutorials, troubleshooting, and reference guides:
  • W3Schools
  • CodeAcademy
  • Stack Overflow
  • Shay Howe
  • SitePoint

If you're ready to apply custom CSS to your site, we have guide on the documentation here
E.g: .header{background-color:red}

google_font_key.label: Google Font API Key
google_font_key.comment:
You will need a Google API key to make use of google fonts. Your key is free and easy to get. However, many people get confused on this. It's really quite simple:
  • 1) Logged in to your Gmail account;
  • 2) Go to the Google Developers Console.
  • 3) Create a project (example: "my google fonts");
  • 4) Select a project.
  • 5) In the sidebar on the left, select APIs & auth In the list of APIs, make sure the status is ON for the Google Fonts Developer API.;
  • 6) In the sidebar on the left, select APIs & auth, In the list of Credentials click on Create new key, then choose Browser key, end click on Create button
  • 7) Copy the API key under "Key for browser applications", that's it.
Click on this link http://vimeo.com/83986921 to view demo how to create new google font api key.

google_fonts.label: Import Google Fonts
google_fonts.comment:
Font preview is available on Google Web Fonts
Google Fonts makes it quick and easy for everyone to use web fonts, including professional designers and developers.
You can even customize them for your own use, or collaborate with the original designer to improve them. And you can use them in every way you want.
Select which google fonts should be imported to your site. Hold SHIFT + left click a font to multiple select.

google_fonts_weights.label: Google Fonts' Weights
google_fonts_weights.comment:

Eg: 200,400,321,800.Leave empty to use default weight.
